subject: Law
title: Patent Trolls
description: A quick, practical guide to Patent Trolls.

hook.text: A company that makes nothing sues a tech giant for billionsâ€”armed only with a vague patent it bought cheaply.

buildup.text: Patent trolls acquire patents not to innovate, but to sue companies for infringement and extract settlements.

discovery.text: They target small businesses that can't afford litigation. Settling for $50,000 is cheaper than fighting in court.

twist.text: Trolls cost the US economy billions annually. Many patents they wield are broad, vague, or arguably invalid.

climax.text: Reforms like inter partes review let companies challenge bad patents at the Patent Office before going to court.

punchline.text: Patents should reward inventors. Trolls reward lawyers.

quiz.question: What do patent trolls primarily do?
options: Buy patents to sue others for infringement
